title.narrative: WATER PROVISION - HHS

description.narrative: Households in targeted communities have access to sustainable safe water by 2018, which contributes to Sanitation, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3.0 Improved and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation and healthy environment and improved hygiene practices

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FISHERIES AND MARINE RESOURCES MFMR

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Households in targeted communities have access to sustainable safe water by 2018

description.narrative: An estimated 102,406 more people across 13 districts in Sierra Leone gained access to a sustainable basic source of water through the construction and rehabilitation of the water supply system in 55 new communities supported, of which a total of 52,227 (51 per cent) beneficiaries are women. An additional 28,388 beneficiaries were supported during the 2019 flooding, over half of which were women. (Please see note below on Output Headline.) | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
